articles.title: Is It Time To Talk About¬†‚ÄúCSS5‚Äù?
articles.description: The W3C CSS-Next community group is actively searching for better approaches for how we describe the evolution of CSS over time and identify feature sets as effectively as we did with CSS3 way back in 2009.
articles.author: Brecht De Rutte

articles.title: The Art of Dithering and Retro Shading for the Web
articles.description: A lot of time spent building a striking effect for the Web has turned into an equally fantastic deep dive on the concepts around rendering graphical effects using shaders. This is advanced stuff, but it‚Äôs great to know it‚Äôs possible.
articles.author: Maxime Heckel

articles.title: The EU's 'AI Act' is Here
articles.description: Not particularly frontend focused, but this EU legislation could well have far reaching ramifications. The Artificial Intelligence Act is the first-ever legal framework on AI, attempting to address its risks along with positioning Europe as a leader in AI legislation.
articles.author: Alvaro Montoro

articles.title: Video with Alpha Transparency on the Web
articles.description: Native ways of tackling rendering video with transparency are said to be ‚Äúinefficient and buggy‚Äù, but Jake has a solution (and a ~2kB npm package to boot).
articles.author: Jake Archibald

articles.title: What If You Used Container Units For‚Ä¶ Everything?
articles.description: An interesting experiment, but Chris notes ‚Äúthat it‚Äôs not that easy. There are plenty of things that container queries are awkward at or just not the right unit for‚Äù.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: HTML Web Components Make Progressive Enhancement And CSS Encapsulation Easier
articles.description: A look at three specific examples that show off key features of Web Components, including CSS style encapsulation and opportunities for progressive enhancement.
articles.author: Kev Bonett

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†3D Scene ‚Üí Object ‚Üí Chicken: A Complete 3D CSS Guide
articles.description: A new video series looking at creating 3D scenes and objects with CSS.

articles.title: Browsers, Cookies and Surfing the Web: The Quirky History of Internet Lingo
articles.description: As new technologies develop, we adopt words or create novel ones to fill in the linguistic gaps.

articles.title: Learn Web Components
articles.description: If you‚Äôre looking to scrub on your web components know-how, this road map should prove useful. It‚Äôs a curated collection of third party articles covering a wide range of related knowledge.

articles.title: Calendar Link: Dynamically Generate Event Links for Calendars
articles.description: Generate event links for Google Calendar, Yahoo Calendar, Outlook, etc.
articles.author: Anand Chowdhary

articles.title: Whirl: A Unique Library of CSS Loading Animations
articles.description: Not a new tool, but we‚Äôve never featured it before. It includes a little over 100 animations, many of which you likely won‚Äôt find in similar libraries. GitHub repo.

articles.title: SVG Viewer: View, Edit, and Optimize SVGs
articles.description: A powerful little web app with options to optimize, prettify, rotate, flip, change dimensions, and convert the SVG to React, React Native, PNG, or even different types of data URIs.
